website_summaries.verdict: The JVC HA-NC250 Noise Canceling Headphones make a great travel companion for those who demand quality sound. And they may not be cheap, but they seem that way next to the Bose QuietComfort 3.
pros: The JVC HA-NC250 Noise Canceling Headphones are comfortable and offer good sound quality, including tight bass response
The headphones work with or without the noise-cancellation feature activated
JVC includes handy accessories such as a compact, hard-shell carrying case, an airplane adapter, and a quarter-inch plug
cons: The cable that comes with the JVC HA-NC250 is too short for nonportable use

customer_reviews.title: Very happy overall using them for 8 years
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful passive and active noise cancellation for a lower price than Bose and other high end products. Blocks airplane engine noise and similar drone-type noise very effectively. Speaking sounds are not blocked as effectively. In quiet settings, the noise cancellation can be turned off but the base performance isn't as good so I usually turn it on. However, this adds a low level of background hiss so it's a trade-off. The ear cups eventually do wear out and fall apart but you can buy replacements from JVC. Eventually, the attachments to the over-head band split apart and I hold them together with black zip ties. Still happily using these an hour or so per day after 8 years!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this JVC model before, and it lasted 10 years until the right ear phone snapped off last week. Despite a review I read warning that the same thing might happen with newer versions, I ordered it anyway. I should have heeded the warning. The instant I put the headphones on for the first time, the right earphone snapped completely off in my hand. JVC's quality, at least for this model headset (at $70), has really declined. I returned it the same day and bought Bose. It's worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: HarveyB

customer_reviews.title: Be forewarned - Inferior Product
customer_reviews.text: #1. I’m an honest person who always looks at the world as “cup half full” but I don’t know where to begin when inscribing this inferior product. The cheap materials resemble something you might find in a box of Cracker Jacks. Be forewarned the plastic is thin, the controls are tiny and the sound is inferior. I feel ripped off. I read that the product was a good value. It was a blatant lie. I should have gone to Best Buy and tested them myself.
customer_reviews.author: Starboard51

customer_reviews.title: does the job for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable headphones to wear: the cups are smaller than I would have liked. Noise cancelling is adequate on a long plane flight. Sound quality is OK; not at Bose-level, but neither is the price. The hardshell carrying case is a nice free accessory. Would have liked to see a volume control on the headphones. Opening the battery compartment is a difficult task (and it should not be). Altogether positive experience, but would shop around before buying this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Deamici

customer_reviews.title: Great for canceling noise from airplanes.
customer_reviews.text: It does not cancel people talking to you but if you are traveling it cancels white noise like on a plane. Great for watching a movie or listening to music. I bought a second pair since my husband took mine. Make sure you get the ones with the hard shell carrying case. The best thing is they are not as expensive as other major brands for the same job.
customer_reviews.author: Nilsa

customer_reviews.title: Bought twice. Both broke.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones twice, mainly for long car/bus trips. No complaint about the qualities of sound but they both broke. The foam ear pads actually split from the materials holding them. It’s really a shame because i initially thought it was my fault. I was satisfied with them enough that i gave them another chance. Was disappointed when the same issue came up for a second time.
customer_reviews.author: Guh

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price, not Bose quality but good enough
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and runs on AAA battery for a good while. Bose are very nice but I am happy with this purchase. Have had it for years, case is rugged ( use the extra space around the middle to store my IPod Classic, even though it is not meant to) Flown numerous places and blocks out most of the noise from crying children, drunks, and loud talkers. I purchased the KOSS VC/20 Volume control, to boost up the volume some more to the headset :) I just lost mine which sucks but will buy another for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jayr

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife to use when we fly. First they are not very comfortable. Second they do a bad job of keeping outside noise out. I should have spent the money and bought her a good set of Bose headphones, penny wise and pound foolish in this case.
customer_reviews.author: old dude

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones that block virtually all the noise and are durable
customer_reviews.text: I've had a pair of these headphones for about 3 years now. They've lasted a long time and they've endured 50+ flights and travel. I love these headphones. The positive: * They block more ambient noise than any other pair I've had (include my Bose Comforts I use at work) * They are on ear which probably helps * They work with or without batteries (but don't cancel much without batteries) (Again, unlike Bose Comfort 15 which require batteries to run) The Constructive: * They can hurt your ears after 4 or 5 hours over your ears (duration varies based on how strong your ears are) Awesome headphones. Love them. Fraction of the cost of so many others.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Eph

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but hurt ears after a while
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for several years. For the price they're ork great on airplanes to drown out sound. They do get a bit painful on your ears if you wear them more than an hour so cross country flights can literally be a pain. Cord started to deteriorate after a few years, but overall they have held up well. If you have the money I would spend the money on Bose over-the-ear headphones, but for a reasonably priced set of headphones these aren't bad. Would give four stars, but pain on ears brought them down to three.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Zadnik

customer_reviews.title: The ear muff on one side broke off from the head band piece
customer_reviews.text: I liked the sound, thought it was awesome. But it broke in a joint. Tried to get a replacement but they refused. I only had it for about a month. I bought it for personal use. They offered a refund but I did not want a refund just wanted a replacement. They gave me a $10.00 credit. Am looking for a new one elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: annab

customer_reviews.title: These headphones gave me a nice quiet flight from the US to India
customer_reviews.text: These headphones gave me a nice quiet flight from the US to India, which alone is worth quite a bit. They're pretty low profile as far as noise cancelling headphones go, which I appreciate - I hate wearing huge cans on my head. I purchased a mic cable and now I use these for everything: music at home, meetings with remote co-workers, and flying. The only complaint I have right now is that after several hours (we're talking 6+) my ears start to feel a little sore. I'll rarely have these on for an uninterrupted six hours, and I've used plenty headphones where the soreness starts at the 1-2 hour mark so I'm fine with that minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Shawn Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, good ambient noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, good ambient noise reduction. Conversational human voice is not reduced much, so not useful to block sound in public areas. Good battery life. Used for hours daily for many years of rigorous use, when various mechanical components began decaying and breaking. Second identical headset is still in use after 6 years and still using original audio cable, with new cable as spare. In other headphones, especially Sony, the audio cable was the poorest part of the construction. Of note: single audio cable to one ear (good), on ear seal (ok, because over ear phones are thick and heavy); sound without noise reduction not high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good not great.
customer_reviews.text: Am on my 4th pair of noise cancelling headphones now. Started with Panasonic (excellent), then graduated to AudioTechnica (very good), then these JVCs. A friend just gifted me a pair of BOSE. My ranking in terms of sound quality and noise cancellation (best to worst): Panasonic BOSE AudioTechnica JVC But all of them do a very good (or better) job. So the differentiator might be price. BOSE are so much more expensive, Panasonic isn't available anymore, so I would recommend the AudioTechnica if you can get them for around $150.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John Egan

customer_reviews.title: Really Worked Well In The Airplane
customer_reviews.text: Put on my new Noise Canceliing Headphones and pressed the button and Voila....hardly heard those stupid engines. Actually, they are NOT stupid engines...needed them to work properly from Miami to Barcelona, Spain. The person next to me had purchased the Bose noise cancelling headset and I asked to try them on. Yes, they worked a LITTLE better, but not worth the additional price. My JVC worked just fine and I would recommend them on all airline flights...short ones and especially on long ones. My flight was almost 10 hours and I love my JVC HANC250 Noise Cancelling Headphones. Purchase one and you will NOT be sorry!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Len

customer_reviews.title: Not so much for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these headphones in 2010. For the price they are nice headphones. The speakers swivel, the headband expands , and the foam on the ears are comfortable letting you keep the headphones on for a long time without discomfort. The noise canceling feature works very well and knocks ambient noise down to acceptable levels. They work great for airplanes, but I personally think they are a bit too big for travel. I sometimes take them for longer flights. They come with a nice carrying case in which everything fits nicely and has a netted area to store the cable and/or a MP3 player.
customer_reviews.author: Pmazon

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, headband fell apart
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our daughter, and she’s used them about 6-7 times when traveling on airplanes or road trips and while they worked fine, the quality of the materials and construction is pure junk. They are less than a year old. The headband broke where the ear piece connects, the plastic was really soft and fragile, and the warranty support line rings no answer and disconnects, and the warranty webpage isn’t valid from their website and redirects to a nonexistent site. Total BS.
customer_reviews.author: Marc R

customer_reviews.title: Good noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Good noise cancellation, decent battery life as well. Only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is for instrumental/bass background music quality. Not bad at all, just not to a professional standard. I'd recommend if simply looking for decent noise cancellation for flights, etc. but not necessarily for a studio level sound.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: Best deal for travel
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to spend a fortune for travel noise canceling earphones and these are comfortable and good sound quality. So much more comfy than the crappy airline earbuds...and these fold pretty well. Excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: Packratinaz

customer_reviews.title: For the price great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these headphones for over a year. Mostly in the gym when working out or when travelling in the car or airplane. I have not had chance to compare them to other NC headphones, but they work great for me. In an airplane I compared them to regular headphones and was able to lower the volume to half (of the regular ones), and the sound was very clear and enjoyable. In the gym, the noise cancelling (with adequate volume) is able to completely filter out TV or radio sound, which is default running there (and I don't want to listen to).
customer_reviews.author: Marek

customer_reviews.title: Ear Pads Disintegrated
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones for just over a year and have used them twice on airplane trips, have taken good care of them. To my shock I found that this past week when I used them the black covering of ear pads were coming off in flakes all over my neck and head. No way have I misused them or even given them more than the occasional use. I can't return them because I've had them too long, and I would never replace the pads (for $13.95 each ear) with the same problematic pads. I am going to pursue returning them to the company. Can't use them like this. They are useless.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Better with the noise cancelling turned on but only slightly ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for almost 4 years (purchased in Feb of 2011) with no problem. The sound quality is outstanding! Better with the noise cancelling turned on but only slightly less outstanding with noise cancelling turned off. They have held up through two deployments (although admittedly not used very loud during those periods). Still, after only 4 years the sound is still just as good as new. The only indications of wear is the the finishing surface of the earpads are wearing. Outside of that, the only maintenance required is replacing a AAA battery on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lowell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, reduces airplane noise by about 50%
customer_reviews.text: I bought these solely for when I travel back and forth to California on a plane. Since there are already so many reviews, I'll just toss in a few quick comments. On a plane, when you turn on the noise cancelling, it cuts that humming of the engines down by about half. It is an improvement. The overall sound is good for movies and music. Obviously it would be nice if they cut the noise down to almost nothing but, for the price, I'm satisfied with their performance. They come with a hard case and fold up nicely into that case. It's not a particularly small case though. Good headphones for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas ParkerTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as promised.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before I purchased and for the most part they were correct. I work in the aviation industry and decided to give these a try as I have to commute to work via an airplane to get to my base of operation. This product is just OK. It does a fair job cancelling the engine noise when used on the airplane. It does not drown out people noise which is really what I was looking for. It also had a low static background noise which slightly interfered with sound quality. Sending these back, fellow coworkers recommended Beats. Will give those a try next.
customer_reviews.author: FlygirlKS

customer_reviews.title: Great value headphones for air travel.
customer_reviews.text: I thought about spending more on noise cancelling headphones because I travel a lot, but decided to err on the side of cheap. I was so happy with these JVCs that I bought a second pair for my wife. One small complaint is that the sound volume in each ear is slightly out of balance. It's barely noticible and i was able to correct it using the accessibility settings on my phone but some people might find it annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: The plastics came apart a couple months ago but the ear cups are still fine. They did a fine job for about 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2013 and decided to review it after over 4 years of use. They have finally died, although only from a mechanical standpoint. The plastics came apart a couple months ago but the ear cups are still fine. They did a fine job for about 2 years of heavy use and 2 years of light use. I finally just got my Bose QC25s, that will be the replacement noise cancellation headphones.
customer_reviews.author: amenon

customer_reviews.title: Like Getting a Seat Upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: For a while now I've considered some noise-cancelling headphones for air travel. I recently had a long-haul flight to Asia and thought that perhaps having some personal quiet would take some of the stress and fatigue out of the trip. Thus the purchase of these headphones. Tried them out at home and was not terribly impressed. But once on the plane and airborne it was like being in a completely different world. The noise cancelling really made a difference, and I arrived feeling much more alert than I have in the past after 13 hours on an airplane. Most definitely worth it if you are looking to improve your experience of air travel!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Flanders

customer_reviews.title: Good noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Very good noise cancellation. Note that all noise cancellation headphones only work with "constant" noise such as airplane engine, etc. 2. The noise cancellation circuit also amplifies the music and boost the bass. Good sound quality. 3. The headphone case has enough room for your mp3 player. 4. Comfortable to wear but it may slip out of your ear when you turn your head against airplane neck pillow, etc. Cons: 1. The airline dual plug adapter is defected. Only hear one side. 2. Not easy to replace the battery due to the design. It may be damaged after many battery replacements.
customer_reviews.author: An

customer_reviews.title: I would likely buy another pair
customer_reviews.text: Love it! There are only three negatives that I've encountered with these headphones: 1) They are not rechargeable. You must forcibly remove one earpad to replace the AAA battery after about 50 hours of use. 2) They are on-the-ear headphones, so their noise cancelling feature is not as effective as over-the-ear headphones. 3) They are extremely tight when you first get them, and can be uncomfortable to wear for more than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Dewd

customer_reviews.title: Great for what they do.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones for when I am studying in a noisy environment. They are great at noise reduction. They sound pretty good too. Don't buy these and expect them to sound like audiophile headphones. The best audiophile headphones are open design and thus have no noise reduction at all. These are great for the purpose they were created. No one pair of headphones can satisfy every situation. You would not wear your audiophile headphones jogging for example. These are meant for noisy environments where your audiophile headphones or your little earbuds would be useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw ruins an otherwise great headset
customer_reviews.text: I love these things except the slightest vibration when the noise reduction is on causes the sound to click in and out. I thought my pair was just broken and exchanged them with Amazon -- next pair has the same problem right out of the box. I'm looking at the reviews here and a bunch of people have complained of the same in different terms. I'm so bummed. These are a great price and nice in every other way. Now I have to buy a more expensive headset to block out my noisy coworkers, arg!
customer_reviews.author: Erikopolous

customer_reviews.title: Won't fly without them!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Pros: The noise cancellation is very noticeable- when people who are traveling with me try them on, they are shocked by the difference these make! They don't eat batteries- which is great because I *hate* running out of batteries in the middle of nowhere. The cord is detachable- makes getting up and down in the plane easier- simply pop out the cord and go about your business. Cons: Can make my ears feel squished after too long- because they fit on your ears, not around them, for really long flights my ears can end up a bit sore.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: excellent noise-cancelling Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I was fortunate enough to find these being sold at half-pice used by a dear seller, in fine used condition and after researching many other and using others for yrs I was so blessed to find this and trusted all would be well. They are as described and reviewed and holding up for me so far in couple months being careful with them to make sure they last! They have good noise-cancelling from others I have used on lower scale, fit well comfortable and the battery lasts longer than less expensive ones I have been using for yrs. Thank you seller and amzon for this gem!
customer_reviews.author: soulcoachsuzanne

customer_reviews.title: Solid but not built to last
customer_reviews.text: While not an audiophile I do appreciate the quality of sound that the headphones provide, especially without having to crank up the headphones. Having had them for over a year I had started to feel that, given the cost, I had achieved a ROI on my initial investment. That is, until, a piece of the plastic that holds the metal portion of the head set in place simply snapped off. I have left the headphones at the office for use there and have rarely traveled with them at all, given the lack of wear and tear this set has experienced, I would have thought (or hoped) that the headphones would have lasted somewhat longer.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but not all that silent
customer_reviews.text: When you flip the switch to turn on noise cancelling, its noticeably more silent, but maybe not what you expect. It doesn't so much cancel sound, but cancel certain frequencies. Any annoying electrical hums (for people who study in a B&N cafe I'm talking about refrigerators, cappuccino machine, microwave) are instantly gone and it almost feels weird at first. That being said, you can still hear the person talking two tables away, you just might not care as much because the conversation is not nearly as audible, unless you really try to listen. That being said, the batteries last longer than you could want, and assuming you're not an audiophile, music still sounds good with the noise cancelling turned on.
customer_reviews.author: roola

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use when I mow my lawn. I have a 23 hp tractor and these headphones let me listen to music while cutting off most of the engine. I've had them for 3 years and loved them till my dogs ate them. I looked around at other Noise cancelling headphones and refuse to pay over $200 for head phones that are not that much better then the JVC HANC250, this includes Bose. Dollar for dollar best deal. I have also seen these on the internet for $250 so amazon also has the best price. Will be getting a new pair and hopefully keep them away from the hounds.
customer_reviews.author: Phil DeDog

customer_reviews.title: great on airline travel
customer_reviews.text: This noise canceling headset was purchased mainly for use while traveling on airplanes. Now that they have been used several times I can say that they really do cancel most of the noise. For safety reasons the external noises are still semi audible. Most legs of travel are between 3 and 4 hours, and the headset remains comfortable during that time. Having the compact travel case, that easily slips into a briefcase or small carry-on, offers good protection for the head-set. Glad that I tried this brand, at a much more reasonable cost, than some other brands. The JVC HANC250 works just fine!
customer_reviews.author: KathyB

customer_reviews.title: Great sound from these JVC earphones.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound reproduction. I'm glad my old headphones reached the end of their life. It gave me the opportunity to experience these and I use them almost daily. They are lightweight so I can use them for long periods of time without them weighing down on my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S Lea

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE WASTE OF $70
customer_reviews.text: Horrible.. Not as described in description. The headphones broke before i even got them out the package. Flimsy design.. dont go cheap on Amazon for a cheap pair of headphones. I went to Guitar Center and bought a great pair of AKG for under the price of these JVC peices of crap..
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone Michael Dangerfield

customer_reviews.title: On first use while flying, noise cancellation didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this headphone for overseas flight 3 weeks prior to trip. After 20 minutes noise cancellation stopped working. When back in states, couldn’t return headphones for replacement since “30 day guarantee” expired. If you are purchasing for airplane use make sure you buy them prior to departure and make sure its a short trip!
customer_reviews.author: Bonbon

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking at Noise Canceling Headphones for about a year but refused to pay $300 for the Bose. After reading about 200 reviews, I decided to give these a try. They were small enough to easily carry and had a nice look. The audio quality is very good - a tad bit light on the base. The noise canceling is about a 7/10 which, for the price, is great. The battery life is excellent and they are very comfortable. We flew from the US to Germany and they were very comfortable. Strongly recommend for anyone looking to reduce airplane noise without spending $300.
customer_reviews.author: mcgman

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality (you can use also when batteries are out), decent noise canceling, poor build quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound quality and the the fact that if you run out of battery energy you can still use them even without noise canceling. After a couple of years of use though, even though carrying them in their case, the foo-leather on the earpads started peeling away and one of the sliding arms broke. Construction quality is the biggest weakness. More than happy with the sound quality though, while the noise canceling capabilityis decent.
customer_reviews.author: BarneyPanofsky

customer_reviews.title: disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these portable headphones to use especially during air travel and after only a few trips, the connection between one of the ear covers and the headband broke, making them now unusable. I carried them in a sturdy computer bag in the carrying case/bag that they came in, but would warn travelers that a more rigid case is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: EdZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I travel fairly often and had always thought about buying a pair of noise canceling headphones but resisted due to the cost. I had always heard that Bose was the standard but spending $350 was out of the question for me. So I looked for a lesser expensive substitute. After reading the reviews on the JVC NC250, I decided I would take the chance and bought some. I have to say I used them to fly to Europe last week and was pleasantly surprised. They work excellent! Whether using them for reducing the plane noise to sleep or for watching movies, they performed very well. I would recommend them to anyone. I feel this was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Akzme2

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Have had them for several years with no problems. Use on aircraft to hear audio of movies. Work very well. Audio quality very good. If you are going to use only for noise cancellation these are cancel about 75 % of engine noise.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ciarciaglino

customer_reviews.title: Work great and very comfortable for an 11 hour flight
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are like magic. I turn them on and the outside noises fade away. The packing case is perfect for travel and they were comfortable during my entire 11 hour flight. Of course I do have a tiny head so for you larger head people I can't vouch for comfort. The battery life lasted me about 16 hours and the case is big enough to carry extra batteries easily. Overall I am very happy and not at all disappointed that I opted for this over the more expensive brands out there.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Hurts your ears, wouldn't recommend unless your using them for short time periods
customer_reviews.text: I get clear sound and they seem like a quality pair of headphones. The one big thing I don't like is they hurt your ears after wearing for a while. I use these whenever I fly to watch movies and listen to music. The problem is they don't go around your ears, they lay ontop of them. So after an hour or so, your ears start to hurt. These are probably cheaper now (I paid over a 100 for them a ways back. I wouldn't suggest them based on that one issue. If you don't plan on using them for long periods then they are fine
customer_reviews.author: vballplayer30

customer_reviews.title: BEST VALUE for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at numerous noise-cancelling headphones before buying, and I kept thinking "Should I spend the additional $150-200 to make sure I have something great?" Then the cheapskate in me took over, after reading reviews that said this item performed beautifully, at a much lower price than some of its competitors. THEY WERE CORRECT! I can't imagine anything giving better sound or doing a better noise-reduction job. Great item. Even on a cross-country flight they're very comfortable and the time flies when I just pop in my I-Pod and go. Very well-padded ear pieces, and the design and operation are extremely simple. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Heyguru

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Extremely durable and sound quality is great- -better than more expensive Sennheisers. I use them every day and finally had to buy a new set because the wire started to open up and cause static. That's due to sleeping with the headphones on for about 2 years. I think the first set would have lasted forever if I didn't sleep with the wire kinked in the pillow.
customer_reviews.author: surfer

customer_reviews.title: Super noise canceling
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ear phones for a trip to China (13 hours in the air each way). They do a superb job of making the airplane noises and everything else in the cabin recede into the far distance. They give very high quality sound from the airplan entertainment system as well. They are reasonably comfortable to wear. One AAA battery lasted about 16 hours, a bit less than JVC claims. The case and accessories are well thought-out. There is enough room to add a sleep mask and a surgical mask (for protection against H1N1 spread by coughing and sneezing) Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Winston LeChat

customer_reviews.title: Ear cups are too small to cover my ears
customer_reviews.text: The ear cups where too small for me, but fitted my wife's smaller ears fine. Judging from the many superlatives about its noise-cancelling this may be a great buy for those whose ears are on the smaller size such as those of most females. I did not test the noise-cancelling myself, however. I ended buying the Audio Technica noise-cancelling headphones because they worked great (and had great sound) and my ears fitted into their ear cups. However, these cost about $50 more in Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just ok, but you have to handle it gently or it will,break.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was ok and the fit is comfortable. However, the plastic gimbal that allows the headphone to swivel and rotate is fragile and broke after only limited use rendering it useless. Also, the noise cancelling performance is minimal, hardly noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: franco

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation works well. Overall sound quality is a little below that of some higher end headphones. The headphones are light and comfortable to wear for long distances. Makes flying much more enjoyable. Noise cancellation works as expected, works great for cutting out droning noises (Read: Airplane), but isn't going to eliminate someone talking right next to you, but it does dampen those noises also. Overall I would recommend this product particularly for traveling. If you are not going to use the noise cancellation features you maybe able to get a better sound quality pair of headphones at the same price point.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Exellent quality and sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones based on the multiple great reviews on Amazon. I did like an instore review of the more expensive Bose headphones, but the huge price difference and the prospect of losing/breaking a travelling set of headphones made a big difference for me, and I bought the JVC headphones. I have not been disappointed. The outside noise reduction is good, not perfect, and the sound tones in the music are rich. Plus a zipper case comes with the headphones, allowing them to collapase into a flat container that easily fits into a briefcase or bag. Overall nearly 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Doodles

customer_reviews.title: Probably just personal
customer_reviews.text: The fit of these earphones, like many others, is designed to fit ON the outside edges of your ear (pinning the ear to the skull). After a relatively short time, the pressure associated with that became uncomfortable, then painful. Very likely a result of my anatomy, but they didn't work for me. Returned them and bought (cheaper!) headphones that encompass the entire ear and rest against the skull, not the ear.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S

customer_reviews.title: Best N/C Headphones For The Price
customer_reviews.text: These headphones produce excellent high quality sound with great base response. I compared them with a friend's set of his high end Bose headphones and neither he or I could detect any noticeable difference. For maybe a 5 percent improvement in sound quality and noise canceling it's not worth paying more than double the price. I've had a pair of these JVC's for three years now and I just ordered another pair for my wife. They're that good!
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: QC-Like quality at regular price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these based on other Amazon reviews and short time before flying. They arrived on time and work very well. Annoyances: Having to removw an earcup to change the battery, and the cord could be a bit longer. They seem to fit over my ears fairly well, and are excellent at noise cancellation. The battery will probably last about 12 hours. I base this on using the headset for three 2 hour flights, and having the battery give out a little over halfway through a 12 hour flight. A quick battery change and I was back in business. All in all a great value for the price
customer_reviews.author: S. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Gave these to my wife. They are very similar to the fancy Bose ones that cost close to three hundred dollars. Based on my tests of hte Bose ones in stores and these at home, I would say they are within 10% of each other. The Bose might be slightly fancier and better finished, but these ones feel like good quality, the sound is excellent, especially with the noise cancelling turned on, and they are about as light as you are going to get good ones.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Low Expectations...
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations when I purchased these. Most Products in this genre ranged at around 200 dollars. These were half the cost...thus I had half the expectations. I was incredibly surprised how well they did. I had a cross pacific journey and I actually used them to cut down on the engine noise for a much more pleasant flight. I actually now use them quite extensively at my desktop whenever i'm doing work. They seem to make my music that much better by cancelling extemporaneous sound. So to summarize, great quality at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: great sound, low noise. cant wait to try them out on the plane
customer_reviews.text: I just got these and I love them. The sound quality alone makes them great.I bought them based on Amazon reviews. I fly every week for work and my old conventional headphones didn't cut out all the background, ( read crying kids) I put these on and the sound is far better than my passive cancelling Bose units and the background sounds from the room faded away . I like the idea of using standard batteries and cords. I cant wait to try these out on a plane. will update you soon
customer_reviews.author: Paulie Walnuts

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality of music is great and the headphones feel great. I personally did not have any problems with the battery installation, but some people find it a little hard as the ear cover needs to be taken off with care. The noise cancelling is OK not as good as Bose or other high end headphones. I hear a hum when my ipod is pluged in. This hum disappears when I disconnect the ipod. Overall I do not regret my purchase, the 300 dollars Boses was too much to justify only using these when travelling.
customer_reviews.author: A. Karamchandani

customer_reviews.title: Best noise canceling headphones for your money.
customer_reviews.text: On airplanes, these are the best. I have used three different pairs of these and all of the have been consistently high quality. They don't have awesome sound quality but its fine and the important thing is that they dramatically cut down on ambient noise. Good comfort level for a normal flight (less than 3 hours), long flights they hurt a little ( I have a average American male size head.. I think?). For this price point I have looked for the best noise canceling headphones for three years and these have been a happy choice each time.
customer_reviews.author: StLeib

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I fly every week, and typically use in the ear buds that have noise cancellation built in. These work better than the in the ear Sony's. If you buy these for the noise cancellation you will not be disappointed. The price is right as well. The audio is nice. Its not audiophile quality, dont expect to hear Studio Quality sounds, but if the purpose is to have these on a plane, you would not get that anyway. Overall they are a good purchase. They are comfortable. Great for sharing with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great sound cancelling headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these headphones for a year now and I have really enjoyed listening to my music and audio books with them. they solved the original problem of listening in a noisy gym, plus, the quality of the sound is much better than the earbuds I was using. the sound cancelling works very well. The only issue is they do use batteries fairly quickly, so I always keep spares close by. If you're looking for a less expensive sound cancelling headphone this is definitely the one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones in anticipation of a a trip to Bhutan, almost 24 hours actual flying time each way. They did a great job of lowering (although not eliminating) the awful engine drone of the jets. I was disappointed that this new model doesn't have the retractable cord that made the previous version so convenient, but the technology is great. The earphones eventually grew painful to wear after several hours, but careful adjustment seemed to alleviate the pressure on the ears. Note: keep a spare battery in the case. When it dies, it dies.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphone
customer_reviews.text: These headphones produce excellent sound quality and noise reduction. The phones will work in passive mode, with a little reduction in volume, just in case your battery dies. However, the phones have an excellent battery life. It is listed on Amazon under "Over the ear headphones" but they are NOT. They are ON THE EAR headphones and after wearing them for an extended period of time (over seas flight) they do begin to give the user a "head-clamp" pain. For the price these are excellent phones.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I wanted noise cancelling headphones for flights and for the bus ride to work. The noise cancelling works pretty well - not as well as Bose but still decent. I like that they still work as headphones with the noise cancelling turned off, as I find the slight pressure you feel from the noise cancelling gets to me after a while (this "pressure" is present with all headphones I've tried, including Bose) They fit comfortably and sound good to my ear. I haven't gotten to test them out on a place yet, but they definitely cut out most of the drone of the bus engine.
customer_reviews.author: Nora K

customer_reviews.title: This is my second noise cancelling headphones purchase
customer_reviews.text: My first one was the Audio-Technica ATH-ANC7B which claimed to reduce environmental noise by 90%. The JVC HANC250 Noise Cancelling Headphones claims 85% noise reduction. In my experience, they both do the job of reducing environmental noise and I think Audio-Technica was better at it. Audio-Technica headphones were little more expensive and heavier than JVC HANC250. Personally, I prefer less airplane engine noise even if it's little more heavier than JVC HANC250 Headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Using these with my iphone while driving my tractor
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to aviation noise cancelling headsets at $500 to $900 a set so my expectations may be too high. These are better than I expected, great sound, adequate volume, and comfortable to wear. They are a little too light on ear pressure to suit me and I can get better sound attenuation by pressing them against my ears with my hands; but that might get painful after awhile. i'm happy with them, would recommend them and agree the battery placement is unhandy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Caliendo

customer_reviews.title: Newer technology is better than the 80s!
customer_reviews.text: Had an older set by a different company that didn't cut airplane noise, so I decided the technology must have gotten better, and it has. Lite, nice tough carrying case that holds plug adapters, soft ear pads, and sonically very good. External noise is reduced with only a slight bit of engine noise, and also reduces the noise of screaming children! Would buy again. Not 5 star because the on/off switch on ear pad is hard to adjust while on your head. Can't comment on battery life as haven't used them enough.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not good enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the JVC HANC250 and the Sony MDR-NC200D headphones and I returned the JVC's. Both were only OK but I preferred the sound and controls of the Sony. Also, the JVC requires the removal of the ear pad to replace batteries. I wasn't sure how long the pad attaching clips would hold up. Sony has an easily accessible battery compartment at a push of a button. Since batteries only last (2) hours, changing them is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Frederic W McClure

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the Sennheiser PX200
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these and the. Kept the Sennheisers because: 1. As a glasses wearer, the JVC's were less comfortable after the first hour (larger earpads press ear too hard against glasses behind the ear). 2. Passive noise blockage of the closed-earpiece Sennheisers is usually adequate. Decided I didn't need the weight/expense/fuss of battery powered noise cancellation. 3. Sennheisers collapse into a much smaller space.
customer_reviews.author: C. MacPhail

customer_reviews.title: Work very well at reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these for a long flight overseas. We tried them at home first and could not tell much change in turing the noise canceling feature on and off. However, on the plane they were amazing. Cancelled out a significant amount of noise and for watching movies on the plane they were excellent. JVC does a good job and as several reviewers said these are excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sometime writer

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: They cautioned at our office that there would be loud construction noises for a period of several months, so I immediately looked at Amazon reviews for a good noise cancelling headphone option. This one had good reviews and indeed works well for me. Does not totally block noise (as it should not), but muffles it to a very great extent. I typically plug my iPod into the headphones, so Classical or meditation music fully distract me from the jackhammers.
customer_reviews.author: PatCali500

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my dad to use on his international flights. He LOVES them! He can put them on, put a movie on and not worry about having to hear the crying babies, the coughing lady or the discussion being held by the teenagers nearby. Great purchase, well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey C

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Great. Use them for long haul international flights when traveling for work and my home office Mac. Comfortable. Good sound quality. Noise cancellation works pretty well. Great value. Nice case...room for Ipod in it. Had first set 3 years or so when ear pads separated from mounting and plastic portion of head band broke. Head band fixable (Krazy glue) but replacement ear pads not cheap...so I just purchased new set another set of these on Amazon. Good enough value to do it twice.
customer_reviews.author: T London

customer_reviews.title: noise-cancelling works surprisingly well. Amazing bass response.
customer_reviews.text: My dentist's office had a pair and I liked them so well I bought a pair for myself. The noise canceling works really well for steady-state noise like electrical appliances and HVAC. I look forward to trying them out on an airplane flight. Sound quality is quite good, with surprisingly good bass response.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chesavage

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought these. $121.00 including 2 day shipping was a bargain. You will hear a bit of engine noise on a plane, but you will get used to that after a while. Slight and I mean very slight discomfort wearing these with glasses. Battery compartment is a bit squirrely so be careful when putting the battery in. I suggest you put in a high quality battery instead of the one that comes with it so you won't have to change it often. These are the reasons I gave it 4 stars. Overall, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: BigE

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Verified Purchase
customer_reviews.text: These headphones cancelled out the most annoying sounds on my flights to Norway and back. I was able to hear the movie without any interference and the headphones were very comfortable. The cord was just right and did not tangle, and the flight mode button was easy to turn on. The carrying case was very compact and light weight. This was my first pair of headphones of this type and I have no complaints. I would recommend them to airline travelers.
customer_reviews.author: Rebelreg

customer_reviews.title: Great, as long as they last, but they don't
customer_reviews.text: These are great noise cancelling headphones, until they stop working. We have used them solely for airplane travel. The first pair lasted three years of light to moderate use. The second pair lasted two years of moderate use - 4-6 flights a month including international travel. In both cases, they just stopped working - failed to turn on. If you travel a lot, look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good NC but disappointed with midget earphones
customer_reviews.text: I somehow got the impression that the earphones would cover the ears. They don't. I suppose I got the wrong idea because JVC's description said the earphones are elongated and can accommodate adult ears. Even at that, though, the noise cancellation is pretty good. Additional acoustic layers dampen ambient noise even when the NC is not switched on. While I haven't yet tried the headphones for long stretches, it could be that I will come to appreciate the light weight of the unit due to its not having king-sized earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for a fraction of the price of Bose
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for a fraction of the price of Bose, Beats, etc. I've owned a pair of Sennheiser noise-cancelling headphones for over 10 years that I've always liked, but these do an even better job of noise-cancelling. My wife loves them.
customer_reviews.author: MikeB

customer_reviews.title: Terrible build quality
customer_reviews.text: Can't speak to the audio quality of these headphones as they broke before I could even get them out of the box. Replacement pair broke in the same exact spot leading me to believe there is a quality problem with these headphones. Skip the headache, find a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron smith

customer_reviews.title: Good product, supplied battery doesn't last that long
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a long (27 hour total) trip to the Far East. These are the first noise cancelling headphones I've bought, and I'll never go back to the airline supplied phones. They are very comfortable and really cut down on the outside noise. I only discovered on the return flight that the noise cancelling feature kept turning off spontaneously. I could turn it back on after a few minutes, but it cut out again after a few minutes. Once I got home I replaced the battery, and this seems to have solved the problem. The headphones come with several adapters so it appears they can be used with a variety of devices. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Ninja rider

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones because I fly a lot and wanted to be able to hear my in-flight entertainment. I really like the little case they come in, and how conveniently they fold. Also, they work ok, but I now realize I would prefer a pair that envelop the ears - these squeeze a bit too much and I can't wear them for more than an hour. By the way do you know how hard it is to sell noise canceling headphones on craigslist?
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: These do what they're suppose to do..
customer_reviews.text: This is my third set (yea - i left one on the plane..uggh) I suggest you leave a business card in the carrying case or a phone number Operationally - these are very effective - even if the battery dies you can still use as headphones (that's another thing to keep in the carrying case - EXTRA BATTERIES.. although they seem to last for several movies+
customer_reviews.author: jon from jersey

customer_reviews.title: After 2 sets of Bose I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 pairs of bose. The QC1 and 2. The headband broke on both. For the money you spend on bose that should not happen-twice. So I decided to give these a try. I was extremely impressed! Did they sound better than the bose?-No. Did they cancel noise better than the bose?-No. but these are less than 100 and the bose are over 250. All I needed them to do was block out the children and engine noise on the plane and it did both. The sound is great! Quite happy!
customer_reviews.author: John Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Marginal in an airliner, useless in a commuter.
customer_reviews.text: Well, they worked, sort of. I mean, you can tell the difference between when they're off and on but on a recent trip they were pretty useless. In a jet, they cut the noise a little but foam earplugs ($.19) made a bigger difference. In a prop-jet commuter they didn't work at all. They kept searching for a frequency or something and cut in an out about once a second. Extremely irritating and non-functional.
customer_reviews.author: Barnacle Bill

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: A little uncomfortable with glasses. When the battery gets low, the noise cancelling acts a little funky. I had these for years, and they sound OK. Good for plane rides, but if you want to sleep with them in your seat you are better off using earplugs instead.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Ears hurt after 2 hours of use
customer_reviews.text: My husband wore it for 2 hours on the transpacific flight. His ears got so hot and uncomfortable he said he could never use it again. I have a small head and my ears started to hurt after about 1-1/2 hours. I would have returned it if we were not out of the country. It is compact and it does cancel out quite a bit of the engine noise. It is now being used as a regular headset for 1/2 hour increment. A waste of money I would say. If Bose were not so flimsy, I would not have considered any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret S

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying Andrew Lloyd Weber's Requiem for 1st CD
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to go along with the Sandisk Sansa Clip. I'm getting ready for a trip, and wanted a set of sound reducing headphones for the various flights. The first thing I did was to put in the battery...no MP3 player...and turn on the headphone. It was amazing to hear the A/C's blower "disappear", background noise went away, too. I had the television on, and I could still hear it, but the sound was reduced. When I turned on the MP3 player, the headphones (without its power turned on) sounded nice, but once I turned on the headphones the sound was beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: David McGuire

customer_reviews.title: My husband never travels without them!
customer_reviews.text: He's used (and loved) them for years - so when it came time for me to consider NCH, I researched all of them. I was concerned that headphones that fit him would be too large for me - had the convenience of trying them on 1st, they fit great! Just received them yesterday, and these are terrific. My ears are rather scrutinizing -- so pleased to hear awesome clarity and richness! The noise cancelling works great. These were purchased for traveling, but after donning them yesterday after work and getting on the elliptical, I don't think I can put my in-ear headphone on again!!
customer_reviews.author: Cary, NC

customer_reviews.title: They're not Miraculous
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these if you think they're going to magically cancel out other sounds. They do cancel "noise," like the hum of the refrigerator or window A/C, but forget it if you're trying to drown out your kids or slamming sounds, etc. Maybe if you get some that actually form a seal around your ears (these don't), you may have better luck. They're nice, but now worth $100+.
customer_reviews.author: cham

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: This noise-cancelling headphone works well during my long-haul flights. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: KS Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These cancel a great deal of noise when just being worn and used without power or batteries. Once you switch the acoustic tuner on almost all noise is cancelled - albeit from a noisy plane jets, a fan, lawnmowers, or a noisy pet dog. I highly recommend these. Very comfortable and a fraction of the cost of the Bose headphones. Runs on 1 AAA battery and I was able to use one battery flying round trip from Philadelphia to San Francisco.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Briggs

customer_reviews.title: It does not cancel all noises
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, properly priced product. I found those headphones pretty comfortable even for long flights ( I love to watch in flight movies) but do not expect perfect silence on a noise canceling setting like my husband did. You still can hear voices and engines humming but it is so much less than on regular headphones and quality of sound and music you intend to hear is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: JVC NC Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Nice looks, nice case, comes with plug adapters. Comfort and fit are average at best. Headphone ends swivel to allow placement in case but do not swivel sufficiently when worn to fit flat on ear and head leaving one side to apply more pressure than the other and leaving small gap for exterior sound to enter. Noise cancel mode works fairly well, can only judge against NC aviation sets, which are much heavier, but very quiet. Only gets an average grade.
customer_reviews.author: J Brandon

customer_reviews.title: JVC HANC250 headphones
customer_reviews.text: Love them Outstanding sound and noise cancelling. Very comfortable at first, but sitting on the ear, rather than over, they start to hurt a little after a few hours. I am experimenting with placing them a little lower on my ears, seems better. Some have complained of a thudding sound from noise cancellation. Mine started to do this and I put a fresh battery in. Problem solved. I am using them with the Koss cord extension. The Koss plug into my mp3 player seems to suit more securely than the JVC plug, so I recommend using the Koss with these phones.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fewster

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you aren't up for investing in Bose
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd time buying these headphones. The first pair were bought about 9yrs ago, after at least weekly use, they finally gave out (not audio, but the foam earpiece). Great value if you aren't up for investing in Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for my use - sound quality is good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace and older and bulkier headeet from another brand. These are perfect for my use - sound quality is good, and compact. Noise cancellation isn't perfect, but decent for this cost. Great for using on airplanes as the combo of noise cancellation and built it amplification. lets you enjoy the music/soundtrack.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

product_meta.title: JVC HANC250 Noise Cancelling Headphones - Black
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe new JVC HA-NC250 combines outstanding sound quality with advanced noise-canceling and isolation technologies to provide a superior listening experience. The HA-NC250's noise cancellation circuitry includes feedback technology that constantly monitors the noise cancellation process. As a result, the headphones eliminate up to 85 percent of extraneous background noise. To further block noise, the HA-NC250 offers two JVC innovations that help isolate the listener from outside sounds. First, each earpiece employs a double housing structure for an extra sound insulation layer. Second, JVC developed a new technique for attaching the headphone's smooth memory foam cushioned ear pads to the housing that helps isolate background noise. The smooth pads also enhance comfort. These sound isolation features, for which patents have been applied, are especially important since the HA-NC250 can be used with the active noise cancellation switched off. For the best possible sound quality, the new headphone uses a 40mm neodymium driver in each earpiece. For comfort and portability, the HA-NC250 is one of the lightest headphones in its class, weighing just 5.3 ounces. It folds flat, and when folded is slimmer than most competing models. Included with the HA-NC250 are a slim carrying case, a four-foot detachable cord, airline dual plug adapter, and ¼-inch plug adapter for use with many home audio and video components. The headphones use a single 1.5-volt AAA battery for powering the noise cancellation circuitry. Battery life is rated at about 50 hours.

AMAZON.COM



The new JVC HA-NC250 combines outstanding sound quality with advanced noise-canceling and isolation technologies, for a superior, uninterrupted listening experience.



Outstanding sound quality with advanced noise-canceling and isolation technologies. 



Detachable four-foot cable. 



Headphones fold up to fit in included slim carrying case. 

85% NOISE REDUCTION
The HA-NC250's noise cancellation circuitry includes feedback technology, which constant monitors extraneous background noise to eliminate up to 85 percent. For further isolation, JVC employs a double housing structure on each earpiece, providing an extra sound insulation layer. The headphones' foam-cushioned ear pads add one last layer, not to mention they're nice and comfortable for long listening sessions.

The headphones use a single 1.5-volt AAA battery for powering the noise cancellation circuitry, squeezing about 50 hours of use from a single battery.

NOISE REDUCTION ON/OFF SWITCH
For convenience, the HA-NC250's active noise cancellation can be switched off, enabling you to address someone speaking to you, hear announcements on a plane trip, etc.

GREAT SOUND
Eliminating outside sounds is half the job. For the best possible sound quality, these headphone use a 40mm neodymium driver in each earpiece, for high sensitivity and a great frequency response.

ULTRA-PORTABLE
For comfort and portability, the HA-NC250s are one of the lightest headphones in their class, weighing just 5.3 ounces. The phones folds nice and flat, for toting around in the included slim carring case.

Also included are the four-foot detachable cord, airline dual plug adapter, and 1/4-inch plug adapter, for use with a wide range of audio and video components.



JVC HA-NC250 SPECIFICATIONS
WHAT'S IN THE BOX
JVC HA-NC250 Headphones, Carrying Case, AAA Battery, Dual Plug Adaptor, 6.3mm Plug Adaptor

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars904 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
